result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

10:33 AM CO: Vlack, Reporter: Gross, Clerk: Christianson. Prosecuting attorney Michael Joseph Becker in court for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Warren Lee Brandt in court for Howard John Bennett. Defendant Howard John Bennett in court. Court reviews case. Atty Brandt states there was an MRI completed and DE is back home and working full time. Atty Brandt request to vacate competency findings and request to set PH. Atty Brandt waives prelim time limits. Court questions DE re: competency. DE believes he is competent. Court sets PH. Adjourned 10:38 AM
Preliminary hearing scheduled for November 1, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Preliminary hearing on November 1, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
for continuance of 10/7 hearing from DE's wife. Rec'd via fax. ec: DA, Atty. Brandt. kma
DE wife called stating DE received MRI only since last hearing and request to reschedule. Clerk advised Wife to write a letter on DE's Behalf. Clerk provided Fax Number. arc

9:03 AM CO: Vlack, Reporter: Gross, Clerk: Christianson. Prosecuting attorney Michael Joseph Becker in court for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Warren Lee Brandt in court for Howard John Bennett. Defendant Howard John Bennett appeared by video. Court reviews case. Atty Brandt addresses competency, DE will be going through neurological testing, and request additional time for competency due to additional testing. ADA Becker does not take a position at this time. Court sets STC. Adjourned 09:19 AM
Status conference scheduled for October 7, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Status conference on October 7, 2022 at 10:30 am.

10:27 AM CO: Vlack, Reporter: Gross, Clerk: Christianson. Prosecuting attorney Michael Joseph Becker in court for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Warren Lee Brandt appeared by video for Howard John Bennett. Defendant Howard John Bennett appeared by video. Court reviews case. Atty Brandt makes statements regarding competency. Atty Brandt states DE has signed bond. ADA Becker requests factual basis for mental health issue. Atty Brandt makes statements. Court finds probable cause under 971.14 (1r)c. Court holds off with order competency due to DE completing testing within the next 2 weeks with neurologist. Adjourned 10:41 AM
Status conference scheduled for August 31, 2022 at 09:00 am.

This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia. Testing upon reasonable suspicion or at the Court's directive. All costs associated with testing shall be the responsibility of the defendant.

1:05 PM CO: Vlack, Reporter: Gross, Clerk: Lindabaur.  Prosecuting attorney Karl E Anderson in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Howard John Bennett appeared by video.  Attorney Warren Lee Brandt in court for Howard John Bennett. Atty Brandt states he's appearing for Defendant generally. Atty Brandt states DE was hospitalized and there may be cognitive impairment- cognitive assessment to be scheduled. Court informs Defendant of charges, possible penalties and rights. Defendant understands. Bond argument; bond ordered. Court reserves on issue under 971.14. Atty Brandt waives speedy prelim. DE's wife states assessment is to be scheduled within 2 weeks. Court sets STC via Zoom. Clerk to mail bond to DE. Atty Brandt updates DE's address.   gll
